timeline.message:
Vertical Lineage - OMRS events processing
1. Update, Delete Entity, (Re/De) Classify Entity Events are send out for a Glossary Term/Glossary Category if the entity is involved in Semantic Assignment and/or Term Categorization relationships
2. Term Categorization Relationship type added for processing
3. Creation of a SemanticAssigment/TermCategorization Relationships is used to publish out the glossary term context
4. The Glossary Categories are included in the Glossary Term context

Signed-off-by: Daniela Otelea <daniela-valentina.otelea@ing.com>

timeline.bodyText: Would it not be better to have a positive if and  put the subsequent 2 lines inthe body of the if. So you do not need to issue the return?
timeline.author: davidradl

replies.bodyText: I consider an early return makes code more readable and clean.
replies.author: danielaotelea

replies.bodyText: @danielaotelea  For me this is a suggestion, I do not want to battle over style; so for me this can stay as is,  if you do not want to change. I am happy for you to resolve this conversation.
replies.author: davidradl

timeline.bodyText: Would it not be better to have a positive if and put the subsequent line in the body of the if. So you do not need to issue the return?
timeline.author: davidradl

replies.bodyText: I consider an early return makes code more readable and clean.
replies.author: danielaotelea

replies.bodyText:
@danielaotelea in this case I agree with @davidradl
It is better to change the condition and do nothing if it is not met then do "return;"
replies.author: immmus

timeline.message:
Vertical Lineage - OMRS events processing
a glossary term context is build only if the GT has semantic assignments and/or term categorization relationships

Signed-off-by: Daniela Otelea <daniela-valentina.otelea@ing.com>

Vertical Lineage - OMRS events processing
refactoring the new relationship event processing
